nextStep: 12/02 BR Call with Jordan. 2 agencies still to pitch (Askphil and Wolfpack). Running through Payments and Biz case with him on 23rd

sfChangesToday.newValue: 23/02 BR Call with Jordan. He is working through biz case but biggest aspect is going to be the SP since we will not approve Adyen. Agency decision in March. SP call schedulled for 11th March

currentActionItems.question: Do we know the business reasons as to why they are migrating?
currentActionItems.action: Schedule discovery call focused on business metrics and expected outcomes
currentActionItems.notes: Consolidating brands and moving away from SFCC, but specific business reasons (cost savings, performance issues, revenue targets) are not quantified.

currentActionItems.question: Do we have specific quantifiable goals aligned with the project?
currentActionItems.action: Prepare business case framework with benchmark metrics from similar multi-brand migrations
currentActionItems.notes: No specific quantifiable goals (conversion rate improvement, cost reduction, time-to-market targets) discussed. D2C GMV of $51M in Salesforce but not

currentActionItems.question: Do we understand the impact if this goal isn't achieved?
currentActionItems.action: Include cost of inaction analysis in next business case discussion
currentActionItems.notes: Implied that staying on SFCC is undesirable and incumbent agency is being terminated, but explicit business impact of NOT migrating not articulated.

currentActionItems.question: Is there a compelling event in place driving action?
currentActionItems.action: Ask Jordan for exact SFCC renewal/end date and board deadlines
currentActionItems.notes: SFCC contract end date referenced but not specified. Organizational restructuring creates implicit urgency. Compelling Event field in Salesforce is nu

currentActionItems.question: Have I validated the metrics with the customer?
currentActionItems.action: Prepare metrics validation discussion for next sync
currentActionItems.notes: Metrics have not been formally validated — conversation has been about agency selection and contract structure, not business outcomes.

currentActionItems.question: Are the metrics compelling enough to justify change?
currentActionItems.action: Build TCO comparison (SFCC multi-brand vs. Shopify MSA)
currentActionItems.notes: Multi-brand consolidation story and SFCC departure are directionally compelling but lack quantified urgency.

currentActionItems.question: Have I identified the true economic buyer?
currentActionItems.action: Ask Jordan to confirm the approval chain
currentActionItems.notes: Cai Jimmy (IT Director APAC / Global Director of IT) listed as EB. Richard (co-CEO) also referenced as someone who 'can sign this off.'

currentActionItems.question: Do we know who's signing the contract?
currentActionItems.action: Confirm signatory authority when initiating MSA legal review
currentActionItems.notes: Jimmy Cai listed as EB but Richard (co-CEO) described as decision-maker who 'can sign this off.' Unclear who literally signs the contract.

currentActionItems.question: Do we have access to this individual?
currentActionItems.action: Propose introductory call with Richard to discuss MSA approach and multi-brand vision
currentActionItems.notes: Jimmy Cai attended November 2025 group call. Richard has not appeared on any Shopify calls. Access to Jimmy exists; access to Richard is through Jorda

currentActionItems.question: Can we get access?
currentActionItems.action: Formalize request for Richard introduction
currentActionItems.notes: Jordan indicated willingness ('it's good that we've got Richard in place now') and Jimmy already participated in a call.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know what the economic buyer cares about most?
currentActionItems.action: Create executive briefing doc for Richard
currentActionItems.notes: Jordan described Richard as 'extremely impulsive' wanting multi-brand consolidation. Jimmy's specific priorities unknown.

currentActionItems.question: Do you know how they make decisions and allocate budget?
currentActionItems.action: Ask Jordan about budget allocation process and approval thresholds
currentActionItems.notes: No discussion of budget allocation, approval process, or budget authority.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know how they will be making the decision?
currentActionItems.action: Ask Jordan to walk through decision chain: Who approves agency? Who approves contract? Board approval needed?
currentActionItems.notes: Agency selection process is clear (4 agencies pitching). Broader organizational approval process not fully mapped.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know who's involved / buying committee?
currentActionItems.action: Ask Jordan if procurement or finance teams will be involved in contract review
currentActionItems.notes: Jordan, Richard, Jimmy Cai, and Jurryt van Arend identified. Unknown if procurement, finance, or other stakeholders are involved.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know when they want to make a decision by?
currentActionItems.action: Confirm timeline still holds in next sync
currentActionItems.notes: Agency pitches conclude end of January, Q2 project start, close date April 23, 2026.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know what is driving this timeline?
currentActionItems.action: Ask for SFCC contract details
currentActionItems.notes: SFCC contract end and organizational restructuring drive timeline, but no single hard deadline explicitly confirmed.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know what will happen if they do nothing?
currentActionItems.action: Include cost-of-inaction discussion in business case
currentActionItems.notes: Jordan implied staying on SFCC is not viable, but explicit consequences not fully explored.

currentActionItems.question: Have you validated this process with the buyer?
currentActionItems.action: Confirm decision process and timeline during Richard intro call
currentActionItems.notes: Jordan described process informally. No formal mutual validation with Richard or Jimmy.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know what criteria the customer is using to evaluate vendors?
currentActionItems.action: Ask Jordan if any remaining platform evaluation criteria exist or if it's purely agency selection
currentActionItems.notes: Agency evaluation criteria partially visible. Platform-level criteria not explicitly discussed — Shopify is the assumed platform.

currentActionItems.question: Have we discussed all D2C/B2B/POS Omnichannel capabilities?
currentActionItems.action: Schedule discovery around full commerce needs including B2B, POS, and omnichannel
currentActionItems.notes: Only D2C discussed. B2B and Retail GMV null. POS and omnichannel not explored. Payments GPV is $0.

currentActionItems.question: Have we surfaced technical complications (integrations)?
currentActionItems.action: Connect Jordan with Shopify integration resources or case studies
currentActionItems.notes: Jordan explicitly called out NetSuite integration as 'the most challenging bit' due to low IT capacity.

currentActionItems.question: Do we have a mutual action plan in place?
currentActionItems.action: Draft mutual action plan and share with Jordan for validation
currentActionItems.notes: No formal MAP. Process managed informally through Jordan-Ben syncs.

currentActionItems.question: Did we help shape those criteria in our favour?
currentActionItems.action: Prepare 'why Shopify for multi-brand' positioning doc for Jordan to share internally
currentActionItems.notes: Ben has informally guided agency selection and proposed MSA structure. No formal criteria-shaping exercise done.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know who defined the decision criteria?
currentActionItems.action: Ask Jordan who set evaluation criteria and whether others have requirements
currentActionItems.notes: Unknown who defined agency/platform evaluation criteria.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know what their procurement process is?
currentActionItems.action: Ask Jordan how long legal reviews typically take and who is involved
currentActionItems.notes: Ben proposed MSA route, Jordan agreed. Jordan mentioned legal team 'want to look at this once.' Full procurement process not mapped.

currentActionItems.question: Are there likely to be redlines?
currentActionItems.action: Discuss break clause feasibility with Shopify legal
currentActionItems.notes: Jordan wants a break clause for Artipoppe engagement (exit if initial migration doesn't go well). This is a likely redline.

currentActionItems.question: If redlines, how long does review take?
currentActionItems.action: Include procurement timeline question in next sync
currentActionItems.notes: No information on Bugaboo's legal review timeline.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know how long it will take?
currentActionItems.action: Ask Jordan for typical contract turnaround time
currentActionItems.notes: Total procurement timeline unknown.

currentActionItems.question: Do we have contract details?
currentActionItems.action: Begin MSA draft and share with Jordan for initial review
currentActionItems.notes: No contract details shared yet. Ben suggested starting MSA process but hasn't begun.

currentActionItems.question: Have we sent the contract?
currentActionItems.action: Draft MSA and initial sales order for Artipoppe
currentActionItems.notes: Contract has not been sent.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know target date for signature?
currentActionItems.action: Propose target signature date in next conversation
currentActionItems.notes: Ben suggested Q1 contract negotiation. Jordan indicated end of January as good time. Close date April 23, 2026.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know their current issues and why they are reviewing their tech stack?
currentActionItems.action: Continue to document and validate pains
currentActionItems.notes: Multiple pains: SFCC platform fatigue, Wolfpack termination, multi-brand consolidation need, low IT capacity, NetSuite integration complexity.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know how pains are affecting business operations?
currentActionItems.action: Ask Jordan what current tech stack fragmentation costs in time, money, opportunity
currentActionItems.notes: Low IT capacity and organizational restructuring mentioned. Specific quantified business impact not discussed.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know what teams are affected and to what extent?
currentActionItems.action: Include team-level pain mapping in discovery
currentActionItems.notes: Digital CX, IT team, and brand-level teams affected. Extent of impact per team not detailed.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know how urgent it is to solve this pain?
currentActionItems.action: Frame Shopify migration as enabler of broader group consolidation
currentActionItems.notes: Urgency from restructuring and SFCC timeline, but Jordan noted process has been 'slow because of change in company.' Mixed signals.

currentActionItems.question: Can they solve this pain using another option?
currentActionItems.action: Prepare TCO comparison and migration risk assessment vs. staying on SFCC
currentActionItems.notes: SFCC is incumbent. Jordan's language strongly suggests departure. No other platform competitors mentioned.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know why this problem is important to solve now?
currentActionItems.action: Ask what business milestone is the hard deadline
currentActionItems.notes: Organizational restructuring (acquisitions, new leadership) creates a 'now' moment, but not explicitly tied to hard deadline.

currentActionItems.question: Is our solution uniquely positioned to solve this pain?
currentActionItems.action: Reinforce multi-brand MSA advantage in all discussions
currentActionItems.notes: Multi-brand MSA approach, strong agency ecosystem (Code, Flatline, AskPhill), and platform flexibility for phased migration uniquely position Shopify.

currentActionItems.question: Have you identified a true champion (influence + motivation)?
currentActionItems.action: Continue to invest in Jordan as primary champion
currentActionItems.notes: Jordan Sykes (Head of Digital CX & Engineering) is the champion. Actively managing agency evaluation, coordinating with Ben, sharing internal insights

currentActionItems.question: Does your champion have political capital and credibility?
currentActionItems.action: Check in on Jordan's Artipoppe role status in next sync
currentActionItems.notes: Jordan has influence over agency and tech stack decisions but is 'still waiting to hear whether I even have an official position with Artipoppe.'

currentActionItems.question: Have they given insights you wouldn't get otherwise?
currentActionItems.action: Continue building trust and information exchange
currentActionItems.notes: Jordan shares extensive internal insights: org restructuring, leadership changes, Wolfpack termination, agency dynamics, Richard's personality, IT con

currentActionItems.question: Are they connected with the key decision makers?
currentActionItems.action: Leverage Jordan's access for introductions
currentActionItems.notes: Jordan directly connected to Richard (co-CEO) and works alongside Jimmy Cai (EB). Stated 'it's good that we've got Richard in place now.'

currentActionItems.question: Have you been introduced to the decision maker?
currentActionItems.action: Ask Jordan to set up introductory call with Richard
currentActionItems.notes: Jordan has not yet introduced Ben/Shopify directly to Richard. Richard has not appeared on any calls.

currentActionItems.question: Are they willing to bring you into the board/buying group?
currentActionItems.action: Propose group presentation or executive briefing with Richard and Jimmy
currentActionItems.notes: Jordan appears willing to advocate but hasn't explicitly brought Shopify into a buying group meeting. Shared that Richard can 'sign this off' but no f

currentActionItems.question: Why are they such a champion for you?
currentActionItems.action: Continue supporting Jordan's vision and make him look good internally
currentActionItems.notes: Jordan champions Shopify because: (a) believes in platform for multi-brand consolidation, (b) actively terminating incumbent agency, (c) wants unified

currentActionItems.question: Have we asked if doing nothing is an option?
currentActionItems.action: Include in next discovery conversation
currentActionItems.notes: Jordan implies staying on SFCC is unattractive but not formally ruled out.

currentActionItems.question: Are there internal alternatives to our solution?
currentActionItems.action: Ask Jordan if anyone internally prefers SFCC
currentActionItems.notes: Wolfpack is being terminated. No visible SFCC advocate. Could theoretically stay on SFCC with different agency.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know why alternatives are being evaluated?
currentActionItems.action: Ask Jordan for top 3 reasons for leaving SFCC
currentActionItems.notes: SFCC being evaluated implicitly. The 'why leave' is implied but not explicitly detailed.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know why we would win or lose?
currentActionItems.action: Address all three risk factors in upcoming engagements
currentActionItems.notes: Shopify strongly positioned — agency evaluation entirely Shopify-focused, Jordan championing. Risks: Jordan's role uncertainty, Richard's impulsive st
